intro: Sophoclesia sodiroi, commonly known as the velvetleaf or false hibiscus, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to red, typically blooming during the warmer months. It is native to Central and South America and is often found in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and greenhouses worldwide.
